title: HAPPY YEARS Shed HAPPY TEARS
body_text:
EastCoastDodgeball's
3 Year Special!
DAY 1 Veteran J. BUTLER Runs the Show!
You almost don't need adjectives to describe the overwhelming success of the "local phenomenon". Three Years passed - just WOW. Who would have thought.
JAMES BUTLER vs. Who?
The original contest slated for this anniversary featured ECD framer, southpaw
Jim Butler
one-on-one against a surprise mystery opponent. But with tropical storm-like conditions, his secret adversary failed to appear. In the process, "Jimmy Boy" was awarded full creative control and handpicked his one-night rival - the legendary
John Tronolone
! And just when things couldn't get anymore interesting, the self-proclaimed "Creation" Tronolone put his captains career on the line!
Flash Results by Game
Butler: 1
Tronolone: 2, 3, 4
Wild. Wet. Pure fun. Pretty good description, don't you think? And to think the most losing squad sergeant in all of dodgeball history did it again. Tronolone's defied the odds yet again!
Tronolone 3. Butler 1.
Just Some of MOMENTS, Just Some of STARS
Hanna
wasn't the only one that made her presence felt. Take incomparable powerhouse
Kevin Fitzpatrick
for example, or better yet, just get a load of the welts on
Captain Butler's
backside following several stinging bulletball shots!
Semi-newbie
Katie Grand
found out just how violent and vicious
Mr. Kevin J. Megill
- standing comfortably under his umbrella mind you - really is. Countless weapons were rifled at the new female star. While the "Grand" player was busy nursing her wounds,
Dan "Slash" Fitzpatrick's
relentless game-ending performances and the catching clinic by top-ranked
"Punter" Wolf
had eyes glued on the competition.
Michelle Mullins
pelted in the face and the night-ending (and certainly never-before-seen) through-the-fence-door, ricocheted nutshot on
Captain Tronolone
sent everyone home with a glowing smile and memory forever.
The Rules
: Classic two-team match-up.
The Match
: John Tronolone defeated Jim Butler, 3 - 1, in an impromptu
White Flag
Match. Only Tronolone's captains career was on the line.
Captains Statistics
: Tronolone 6-8-0 / Butler 2-1-0. Tronolone established several records for himself: first person to captain a team 14 times; tied for most number of singles contests (10) along with Diana DiBuccio; has competed in and won both
White Flag
encounters; has not lost any matches [thus far] in the 2008 year making this victory his third straight. Butler unfortunately suffered his first defeat ever, with victories over Lindsay Gough and brother Michael Butler during the course of his career. Both Tronolone and Butler were two of the original 12 participants at the inaugural DODGEBALL DAY 1 on September 3, 2005.
Moments & Stars
:
(See above)
Attendance
: 19, comprised of 12 men and 7 women
New Players
: Ashley Hoppe
Other Notes
: DODGEBALL 154 was
EastCoastDodgeball's
3 Year Anniversary special. It was also the 30th
Wet War
thanks Hurricane Hanna.
In a world of extremes,
it's easy to forget there's a happy place in between.
EastCoastDodgeball
September 3, 2005 - Present Day.
Thank You All.
________________________________________
______________________________
Up Next!
From one special gathering to another. It's the Season 16 midway showdown! And this time "Father Knows Best!"
In a highly-anticipated doubles bout,
Bob Cornero
and his pops
Mr. Cornero
take on the equally impressive
Dan Spengeman
and his dad
Mr. Spengeman
! Catch this gigantic main event this Saturday night, September 13, only at Wall High School!
body_html:
EastCoastDodgeball's 3 Year Special!
DAY 1 Veteran J. BUTLER Runs the Show!

You almost don't need adjectives to describe the overwhelming success of the "local phenomenon". Three Years passed - just WOW. Who would have thought.

JAMES BUTLER vs. Who?
The original contest slated for this anniversary featured ECD framer, southpaw Jim Butler one-on-one against a surprise mystery opponent. But with tropical storm-like conditions, his secret adversary failed to appear. In the process, "Jimmy Boy" was awarded full creative control and handpicked his one-night rival - the legendary John Tronolone! And just when things couldn't get anymore interesting, the self-proclaimed "Creation" Tronolone put his captains career on the line!

Flash Results by Game
Butler: 1
Tronolone: 2, 3, 4

Wild. Wet. Pure fun. Pretty good description, don't you think? And to think the most losing squad sergeant in all of dodgeball history did it again. Tronolone's defied the odds yet again!

Tronolone 3. Butler 1.

Just Some of MOMENTS, Just Some of STARS
Hanna wasn't the only one that made her presence felt. Take incomparable powerhouse Kevin Fitzpatrick for example, or better yet, just get a load of the welts on Captain Butler's backside following several stinging bulletball shots!

Semi-newbie Katie Grand found out just how violent and vicious Mr. Kevin J. Megill - standing comfortably under his umbrella mind you - really is. Countless weapons were rifled at the new female star. While the "Grand" player was busy nursing her wounds, Dan "Slash" Fitzpatrick's relentless game-ending performances and the catching clinic by top-ranked "Punter" Wolf had eyes glued on the competition.

Michelle Mullins pelted in the face and the night-ending (and certainly never-before-seen) through-the-fence-door, ricocheted nutshot on Captain Tronolone sent everyone home with a glowing smile and memory forever.


The Rules: Classic two-team match-up.
The Match: John Tronolone defeated Jim Butler, 3 - 1, in an impromptu White Flag Match. Only Tronolone's captains career was on the line.
Captains Statistics: Tronolone 6-8-0 / Butler 2-1-0. Tronolone established several records for himself: first person to captain a team 14 times; tied for most number of singles contests (10) along with Diana DiBuccio; has competed in and won both White Flag encounters; has not lost any matches [thus far] in the 2008 year making this victory his third straight. Butler unfortunately suffered his first defeat ever, with victories over Lindsay Gough and brother Michael Butler during the course of his career. Both Tronolone and Butler were two of the original 12 participants at the inaugural DODGEBALL DAY 1 on September 3, 2005.
Moments & Stars: (See above)
Attendance: 19, comprised of 12 men and 7 women
New Players: Ashley Hoppe
Other Notes: DODGEBALL 154 was EastCoastDodgeball's 3 Year Anniversary special. It was also the 30th Wet War thanks Hurricane Hanna.

In a world of extremes,
it's easy to forget there's a happy place in between.

EastCoastDodgeball
September 3, 2005 - Present Day.
Thank You All.

______________________________________________________________________


Up Next!
From one special gathering to another. It's the Season 16 midway showdown! And this time "Father Knows Best!"

In a highly-anticipated doubles bout, Bob Cornero and his pops Mr. Cornero take on the equally impressive Dan Spengeman and his dad Mr. Spengeman ! Catch this gigantic main event this Saturday night, September 13, only at Wall High School!
